thread.title: Swift Passport Services Announces Phishing for Passports Program
thread.title_full: Swift Passport Services Announces Phishing for Passports Program - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Swift Passport Services Announces Phishing for Passports Program
text:
From now until January 1, 2016, anyone attending one of the three Phish Riviera Maya concerts can renew or obtain a new passport through Swift in just seven to ten business days for an expediting fee of only $50. Please note, US passports currently require a $170 US State Department fee.
Chicago, Illinois (PRWEB) October 05, 2015
Swift Passport Services, a premier visa and passport expediting agency serving clients around the United States, is pleased to announce a special “Phishing for Passports” program for fans of the underground rock band Phish.
Phish will be holding three concerts in Mexico’s Riviera Maya on January 15-17, 2016 . Tickets for these all-inclusive concerts went on sale in early September and quickly sold out. The tickets include a stay at the Barceló Maya Beach Resort – where the concerts will be held – or one of three other nearby resorts, as well as food, drinks, and resort activities.
“Phish is an amazing group that has never been truly appreciated by the main stream music crowd,” Rob Lee, co-owner of Swift Passport Services commented. “This band is known for jam sessions that are incredibly inventive and powerful. Even without major radio hits, they’ve managed to build an extremely loyal fan base and sell over eight million albums.”
Though tickets for the Phish concert in Mexico have already sold out, ticketholders will need to make sure they have a valid passport before heading down to Riviera Maya. Swift hopes to make that process easier for Phish fans with their “Phishing for Passports” program.
From now until January 1, 2016, anyone attending one of the three Phish Riviera Maya concerts can renew or obtain a new passport through Swift in just seven to ten business days for an expediting fee of only $50. (Note that US passports currently require a $170 US State Department fee. Return shipping costs may also apply.) Swift’s hope is that this program will help fans get a passport for the Phish concert in Mexico more easily and much more quickly than they could on their own.
“Passports are one of those things that people tend to put somewhere ‘safe’ and then lose completely. It happens all the time. A lot of people also realize only days before international trips that their passport has expired,” Lee noted. “If you ever find yourself in this sort of situation, Swift should be your first call. We can replace a passport or get you your first one in as little as one to three business days.”
Phish fans in need of a new passport can contact Swift by calling (877) 917-9438 or through http://www.swiftpassportservices.com . Learn more about the Phish Riviera Maya concerts at http://www.phishrivieramaya.com .
About Swift Passport Services
Swift is a trusted passport and visa expediting firm serving travelers throughout the United States. Swift takes the hassle out of applying for expedited travel visas by ensuring that customers have all the materials they need and that their application forms are filled out correctly the first time. Swift also relieves travel stress with its expedited passport services. If you have a last minute trip, your passport gets stolen, or any number of other travel emergencies come up, the team at Swift can help.
